de.codecrafters.tableview

Class TableColumnModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.codecrafters.tableview.TableColumnModel

  • public class TableColumnModel
extends java.lang.Object
    A model holding the column information of a TableView. Such column information is the relative column width (alias ColumnWeight) and the number of columns (alias ColumnCount).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TableColumnModel(int columnCount)
      Creates a new TableColumnModel with the given number of columns.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getColumnCount()
      Gives the column count of this model.
      int getColumnWeight(int columnIndex)
      Gives the column weight (the relative width of a column) of the column at the given index.
      int getColumnWeightSum()
      Gives the overall column weight (sum of all column weights).
      void setColumnCount(int columnCount)
      Sets the column count to this model.
      void setColumnWeight(int columnIndex, int columnWeight)
      Sets the column weight (the relative width of a column) of the column at the given index.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableColumnModel

        public TableColumnModel(int columnCount)
        Creates a new TableColumnModel with the given number of columns. Every column has by default a weight (relative width) of 1.
        Parameters:
        columnCount - The number of columns.

    • Method Detail

      • setColumnCount

        public void setColumnCount(int columnCount)
        Sets the column count to this model.
        Parameters:
        columnCount - The number of columns that shall be set.

      • getColumnCount

        public int getColumnCount()
        Gives the column count of this model.
        Returns:
        The number of columns that is currently set.

      • setColumnWeight

        public void setColumnWeight(int columnIndex,
                            int columnWeight)
        Sets the column weight (the relative width of a column) of the column at the given index.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The index of the column to which this weight should be assigned.
        columnWeight - The weight that should be set to the column at the given index.

      • getColumnWeight

        public int getColumnWeight(int columnIndex)
        Gives the column weight (the relative width of a column) of the column at the given index.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The index of the column to receive the column weight.
        Returns:
        The column weight of the column at the given index.

      • getColumnWeightSum

        public int getColumnWeightSum()
        Gives the overall column weight (sum of all column weights).
        Returns:
        The collumn weight sum.
